I suspect most crawls will like the option that replaced 'pauseAtFinish' 
better:

https://webarchive.jira.com/wiki/display/Heritrix/Release+Notes+-+Heritrix+3.1.0-RC1#ReleaseNotes-Heritrix3.1.0-RC1-CrawlControllerpauseAtEndoptionreplacedwithrunWhileEmpty%28HER1776%29

We try to mention all changes that require operator adjustments in the 
wiki Release Notes, so that's a good place to review to minimize 
surprises. The 'change log' (recent releases) and 'roadmap' (upcoming 
releases) issue tracker views also gives good visibility into changes in 
progress or under serious consideration, once you expand the lists under 
each release name, and then the individual issues usually show the 
discussion/rationale:

'Change log':
https://webarchive.jira.com/browse/HER#selectedTab=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.project%3Achangelog-panel

'Roadmap':
https://webarchive.jira.com/browse/HER#selectedTab=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.project%3Aroadmap-panel

Though, the names of releases and grouping of issues on the 'Roadmap' 
are always subject to change/slippage until the moment a release is made.

- Gordon

On 7/28/11 7:07 AM, progre55 wrote:
> Hi guys,
>
> I've been using H3 for a while now, and recently updated to the latest (3.1 I believe) version, and found out that the "pauseAtFinish" property is gone.
>
> Any reasons for getting rid of it? It's just, it has been really useful for me so far, as I automatically schedule seeds from a database, and when a job is finished, it just gets paused, and when a new seed entry is inserted into the DB, it is scheduled and the frontier is unpaused automatically.
>
> Is there any other ways setting that "pauseAtFinish" parameter?
>
> Regards,
> progre55
